ygData.subject: Re: Hail Warriors! Newbie here
ygData.msgSnippet: BB is an AWSOME place for EXPS if you nkow how to work it.  I was a solo warrior there from 8th to 16th and did that in about a week.  Just learn where
ygData.messageBody:
BB is an AWSOME place for EXPS if you nkow how to work it. I was a solo
warrior there from 8th to 16th and did that in about a week. Just learn
where everything is, and I mean everything, know what gnolls pop where.
then just run around kill the ones that con blue all day long. there are
so many of them that before you even know it you'll be about to level.

Bashor, Barbarian Warrior on Bertox

> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> Greets!
> My male human warrior is Snyak - bound at Qeynos on Innorruk. I made
> level 9
> last night - woo hoo! Twice actually - too many stupid deaths: Holly
> got me
> when I was not looking, that dang Gnoll Commander in Black Burrow that
> hangs
> out on the far side of the river on the left once you get down by the
> rock
> and the first bridge. One time I tried to drag him back to a wizard
> friend
> for an ambush but got dizzy and he whacked me good. Next time, I came
> back
> with more friends - a wizard and a druid and we tried to gang him. We
> had
> him too and then 2 more of his GS buds showed up and we were ded meat
> at
> that point.
> But he is gonna pay for that because I am coming back with all my
> friends
> and we are gonna hand him a full can of KickButt(tm)!
> So, even at level 8 I have been finding it harder and harder to get xp
> -
> solo or in partys. I have been doing either BB (for loot) or West
> Karanas
> (for xp). Are the aqueducts any good for low 9's? I kinda really
> hate
> mazes and tunnels - I still get lost going to the bank! Or is it time
> to
> venture forth? I have been to N Karanas (hate gryfawns with a
> passion!) and
> S Karanas near Split Paw one time but MD seemed low then.
> One of my goals is to try to catch a cleric friend who is at level 14
> (he
> got a real job so he can't play EQ all day long no more :-) But I am
> up for
> adventure as well. And I have spent some time helping others and
> that's fun
> too.
> Any thoughts?
>
>
> ----------------------------------------------------------------------
> --
> Star Wars fans are using ONElist to share the fun.
> http://www.ONElist.com
> Are you?
> ----------------------------------------------------------------------

> For the Honor and Glory of the Warlord, Rallos Zek!
